text:
Company: Adams and Sons  
Role: Training Specialist  

Company Background:  
Adams and Sons is a leading provider of comprehensive training solutions aimed at empowering businesses to achieve peak performance. We specialize in customized training programs that cater to various industries, ensuring a well-rounded development experience for our clients.

Job Type: Full-Time  

Job Description:  
Adams and Sons is seeking a Training Specialist to design, develop, and deliver training programs that meet the needs of our diverse clientele. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in instructional design and be adept at utilizing various training methodologies to enhance learner engagement and retention.

Responsibilities:  
- Develop and implement comprehensive training programs tailored to client needs.  
- Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps.  
- Utilize a variety of instructional techniques and formats, such as simulations, team exercises, group discussions, videos, and lectures.  
- Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and make necessary adjustments.  
- Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure the accuracy and relevance of training content.  
- Maintain training records and provide reports on training outcomes.

Qualifications and Experience Needed:  
- Bachelor’s degree in Education, Human Resources, or related field.  
- Minimum of 3 years of experience in training and development.  
- Proficient in instructional design and adult learning principles.  
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.  
- Adept at problem-solving and independent work.  
- Experience in using e-learning platforms and tools.  

Perks and Benefits:  
- Competitive salary ranging from USD 50,000 to USD 70,000, based on experience and skills.  
- Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.  
- Paid time off and holidays.  
- Professional development opportunities.  
- Flexible working hours.  
- Employee assistance program.

Application Process:  
Interested candidates should submit their resume, cover letter, and a portfolio of previous training materials developed to our HR department by email.
